verses.verse: Job <S%H347><s%> again <S%H3254><s%> took up his parable, <S%H4912><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>
"Oh that <S%H5414><s%> I were as in the months <S%H3391><s%> of old, <S%H6924><s%> as in the days <S%H3117><s%> when God <S%H433><s%> watched over me; <S%H8104><s%>
when his lamp <S%H5216><s%> shone <S%H1984><s%> on my head, <S%H7218><s%> and by his light <S%H216><s%> I walked <S%H3212><s%> through darkness, <S%H2822><s%>
as I was in the ripeness <S%H2779><s%> of my days, <S%H3117><s%> when the friendship <S%H5475><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> was in my tent, <S%H168><s%>
when the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> was yet with me, <S%H5288><s%> and my children were around me, <S%H5439><s%>
when my steps <S%H1978><s%> were washed <S%H7364><s%> with butter, <S%H2529><s%> and the rock <S%H6697><s%> poured out <S%H6694><s%> streams <S%H6388><s%> of oil for me, <S%H8081><s%>
when I went forth <S%H3318><s%> to the city <S%H7176><s%> gate, <S%H8179><s%> when I prepared <S%H3559><s%> my seat <S%H4186><s%> in the street. <S%H7339><s%>
The young men <S%H5288><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> me and hid <S%H2244><s%> themselves. <S%H3453><s%> The aged rose up <S%H6965><s%> and stood. <S%H5975><s%>
The princes <S%H8269><s%> refrained <S%H6113><s%> from talking, <S%H4405><s%> and laid <S%H7760><s%> their hand <S%H3709><s%> on their mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
The voice <S%H2244><s%> of the nobles <S%H5057><s%> was hushed, <S%H6963><s%> and their tongue <S%H3956><s%> stuck <S%H1692><s%> to the roof of their mouth. <S%H2441><s%>
For when the ear <S%H241><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> me, <S%H833><s%> then it blessed me; <S%H5869><s%> and when the eye saw <S%H7200><s%> me, <S%H5749><s%> it commended me:
Because I delivered <S%H4422><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> who cried, <S%H7768><s%> and the fatherless <S%H3490><s%> also, <S%H5826><s%> who had none to help him,
the blessing <S%H1293><s%> of him who was ready to perish <S%H6><s%> came <S%H935><s%> on me, <S%H490><s%> and I caused the widow's heart <S%H3820><s%> to sing for joy. <S%H7442><s%>
I put <S%H3847><s%> on righteousness, <S%H6664><s%> and it clothed <S%H3847><s%> me. <S%H4941><s%> My justice was as a robe <S%H4598><s%> and a diadem. <S%H6797><s%>
I was eyes <S%H5869><s%> to the blind, <S%H5787><s%> and feet <S%H7272><s%> to the lame. <S%H6455><s%>
I was a father <S%H1><s%> to the needy. <S%H34><s%> The cause <S%H7379><s%> of him who I didn't <S%H3045><s%> know, I searched out. <S%H2713><s%>
I broke <S%H7665><s%> the jaws <S%H4973><s%> of the unrighteous, <S%H5767><s%> and plucked <S%H7993><s%> the prey <S%H2964><s%> out of his teeth. <S%H8127><s%>
Then I said, <S%H559><s%> <S%H1478><s%> 'I shall die in my own house, <S%H7064><s%> I shall number <S%H7235><s%> my days <S%H3117><s%> as the sand. <S%H2344><s%>
My root <S%H8328><s%> is spread out <S%H6605><s%> to the waters. <S%H4325><s%> The dew <S%H2919><s%> lies all night <S%H3885><s%> on my branch. <S%H7105><s%>
My glory <S%H3519><s%> is fresh <S%H2319><s%> in me. <S%H5978><s%> My bow <S%H7198><s%> is renewed <S%H2498><s%> in my hand. <S%H3027><s%>'
"Men listened to me, <S%H3176><s%> waited, and kept silence <S%H1826><s%> for <S%H3926><s%> my counsel. <S%H6098><s%>
After <S%H310><s%> my words <S%H1697><s%> they didn't <S%H8138><s%> speak again. My speech <S%H4405><s%> fell on them. <S%H5197><s%>
They waited <S%H3176><s%> for me as for the rain. <S%H4306><s%> Their mouths <S%H6310><s%> drank <S%H6473><s%> as with the spring rain. <S%H4456><s%>
I smiled <S%H7832><s%> on them when they had no confidence. <S%H539><s%> They didn't <S%H5307><s%> reject the light <S%H216><s%> of my face. <S%H6440><s%>

I chose <S%H977><s%> out their way, <S%H1870><s%> and sat <S%H3427><s%> as chief. <S%H7218><s%> I lived <S%H7931><s%> as a king <S%H4428><s%> in the army, <S%H1416><s%> as one who comforts <S%H5162><s%> the mourners. <S%H57><s%>
